sentence.Network_en: They forgot all their fears and all their miseries in an instant.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们马上忘记了一切恐惧和痛苦.

sentence.Network_en: I'm suffering the miseries of unemployment.
The miseries I went through made me suddenly realise with a blinding flash what life was all about.
sentence.Network_cn: 我所经历的痛苦让我突然一下子清楚地领悟到了生活的真谛。

PerfectNetExp.abs: Amid so many private and public miseries he continued calm ., 虽然遭遇到如此之多公与私的不幸事件 , 他仍然保持镇静.
work is the grand cure for all the maladies and miseries that ever beset mankind .工作就是医活人类所有顽疾和厄运的最宏效的药剂。
one can tell the story of the Jewish people as a litany of miseries or as an epic on the theme of above those miseries .一看就知道这个故事的犹太人民，因为一连串的悲惨境遇，或作为一部史诗，其主题是高于那些苦难。
Work is the grand cure of the maladies and miseries that ever beset mankind ., 对于曾经饱受疾病和穷困折磨的人类来说 , 工作无疑是一剂绝世良方.

list.exp: 整天抱怨而从来不开怀的人

example.ex: All that money brought nothing but sadness and misery and tragedy.
example.tran: 那笔钱带来的只有伤心、痛苦和悲剧。

entry.def: Misery is the way of life and unpleasant living conditions of people who are very poor.

example.ex: A tiny, educated elite profited from the misery of their two million fellow countrymen.
example.tran: 一小撮受过良好教育的精英分子从他们200万同胞的贫苦生活中获取利益。

entry.tran: 牢骚满腹者;爱抱怨的人
entry.def: If you say that someone is a misery, you are critical of them because they are always com-plaining.

example.ex: I'm not such a misery now! I gave up drink a few years back and that has changed things a lot.
example.tran: 我现在已经不喜欢抱怨了。几年之前我戒了酒，整个人就大不一样了。

entry.tran: 使生活痛苦;使日子不好过
entry.def: If someone makes your life a  misery, they behave in an unpleasant way towards you over a period of time and make you very unhappy.

example.ex: ...the gangs of kids who make our lives a misery.
example.tran: 弄得我们日子不得安宁的那几帮孩子

entry.tran: (告诉某人其急于想知道的事)消除…的忧虑
entry.def: If you put someone out of their misery, you tell them something that they are very anxious to know.

example.ex: Please put me out of my misery. How do you do it?
example.tran: 别让我着急了。你是怎样做的？

entry.tran: 将(动物)人工致死以结束其痛苦
entry.def: If you put an animal out of its misery, you kill it because it is sick or injured and cannot be cured or healed.

auth_sentence.content: Bernard poured out the tale of his miseries.
auth_sentence.res_content: Bernard poured out the tale of his miseries.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Bernard poured out the tale of his miseries.

auth_sentence.content: But these miseries weren't what really shook her: the week that she found this job, Sergio announced that he had been laid off.
auth_sentence.res_content: But these miseries weren't what really shook her: the week that she found this job, Sergio announced that he had been laid off.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But these miseries weren't what really shook her: the week that she found this job, Sergio announced that he had been laid off.

Sentence.sentence: Distraction is the only thing that consoles us for our miseries.
the French philosopher Blaise Pascal wrote in the 17th century, "and yet it is itself the greatest of our miseries
